TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un hambar è una greppia del cereale o una piccola struttura usata per immagazzinare e l'essiccamento del cereale nei Balcani e le regioni bordering nella pianura di Pannonian. Anche se molti hambars sono generalmente obsoleti, ci sono ancora alcuni hambars trovati durante la regione Balkan. La parola proviene dal significato ambar deposito, magazzino, o deposito di parola turca. La parola nella relativa forma originale, ambar, inoltre è usata in Serbia.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un hambar es un pesebre del maíz o una estructura pequeña usada para almacenar y secar maíz en los Balcanes y las regiones que confinan en el llano de Pannonian. Aunque muchos hambars son generalmente obsoletos, todavía hay algunos hambars encontrados a través de la región balcánica. La palabra origina del significado ambar almacén, almacén, o depósito de la palabra turca. La palabra en su forma original, ambar, también se utiliza en Serbia.

TEXT.English: [TAB] In the Indus Valley, cleanliness was obviously an important part of their society. The ancient cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-Daro of the Indus Valley Civilization constructed complex networks of brick-lined sewage drains from around 2600 BC. These cities also had outdoor flush toilets connected to this network. The urban areas of the Indus Valley also provided public and private baths, sewerage was disposed through underground drains build with precisely laid bricks. Sophisticated water management systems drained the sewage into reservoirs. Drains from houses were also connected to wider public drains.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Dans la vallée de l'Indus, la propreté est évidemment une partie importante de leur société. Les anciennes villes d'Harappa et Mohenjo-Daro de la civilisation de l'Indus construit des réseaux complexes de brique doublure draine les eaux usées d'environ 2600 avant JC. Ces villes ont également outdoor toilettes à chasse d'eau connectées à ce réseau. Les agglomérations urbaines de la vallée de l'Indus a également fourni des bains publics et privés, a été éliminé grâce à l'assainissement des drains souterrains construire avec des briques précisément définies. Des systèmes sophistiqués de gestion de l'eau drainée dans les réservoirs d'eaux usées. Des égouts de maisons ont également été connectés à un public plus large drains.
TEXT.German: [TAB] In der Indus-Tal, Sauberkeit war natürlich ein wichtiger Teil ihrer Gesellschaft. Die antiken Städte und Harappa Mohenjo-Spende der Indus Valley Civilization konstruierten komplexen Netzwerken aus Backstein-lined Kanalisation aus der Zeit um 2600 v. Chr.. Diese Städte hatten auch im Freien flush Toiletten an diesem Netzwerk. Die städtischen Gebieten der Indus-Tal auch die öffentlichen und privaten Bäder, Kanalisation entsorgt wurde durch unterirdische Kanalisation bauen, die genau mit Ziegeln. Ausgefeilte Wasser-Management-Systemen in die Kanalisation entwässert Reservoire. Abflüsse von Häusern wurden auch an weiteren öffentlichen Kanalisation.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Nel cuore della Valle, per la pulizia è stata, ovviamente, una parte importante della loro società. L'antica città di Harappa e Mohenjo-daro della Civiltà della valle dell'Indo costruito reti complesse di mattoni in fila i canali di scolo delle acque reflue da circa il 2600 aC. Queste città ha avuto anche all'aperto flush toilets collegato a questa rete. Le aree urbane di Indus Valley ha fornito anche i bagni pubblici e privati, la rete fognaria è stato smaltito attraverso i canali di scolo sotterraneo costruito con mattoni di cui appunto. Sofisticati sistemi di gestione delle acque di depurazione in prosciugato le riserve. Case da canali di scolo sono stati inoltre collegata a un pubblico più ampio dei canali di scolo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] En el valle de Indus, la limpieza es obviamente una parte importante de su sociedad. Las antiguas ciudades de Harapa y Mohenjo-daro de la civilización del valle Indus construyeron complejas redes de ladrillo-alineadas alrededor de los desagües de aguas residuales 2600 aC. En estos lugares al aire libre había inodoros conectados a esta red. Las zonas urbanas del valle de Indus también baños públicos y privados, de alcantarillado se eliminan a través de los drenajes subterráneos construir con ladrillos precisamente establecidas. Sofisticados sistemas de gestión del agua drenada en los reservorios de aguas residuales. Desagües de las casas también fueron conectados a un público más amplio el sistema de alcantarillado.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Ice hockey began in Canada, and today it attracts more players and spectators than any other sport. Leagues are organized throughout the country. Professional hockey draws thousands of spectators to large arenas and millions to watch their televisions. Enthusiasm is high at the end of the season, when the two best teams of the National Hockey League, more commonly known as the NHL, emerge from a series of playoffs to compete for the Stanley Cup. There are currently six Canadian teams in the NHL. Ice hockey playing-areas are known as hockey rinks.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'hockey de glace a commencé au Canada, et aujourd'hui il attire plus de joueurs et de spectateurs que n'importe quel autre sport. Des ligues sont organisées dans tout le pays. L'hockey professionnel dessine des milliers de spectateurs à de grandes arènes et à millions pour regarder leurs télévisions. L'enthousiasme est haut à la fin de la saison, quand les deux meilleures équipes de la ligue nationale d'hockey, généralement connues sous le nom de NHL, émergent d'une série de finales pour concurrencer pour la tasse de Stanley. Il y a actuellement six équipes canadiennes dans le NHL. Des jouer-secteurs d'hockey de glace sont connus comme patinoires d'hockey.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eis-Hockey fing in Kanada an, und heute zieht es mehr Spieler und Zuschauer als jeder möglicher andere Sport an. Ligen werden in dem Land organisiert. Professionelles Hockey zeichnet Tausenden Zuschauer zu den großen Arenas und zu den Millionen, um ihre fernzusehen. Begeisterung ist am Ende der Jahreszeit hoch, wenn die zwei besten Mannschaften der nationalen Hockey-Liga, häufiger bekannt als das NHL, von einer Reihe Endspielen auftauchen, um für die Stanley Schale zu konkurrieren. Es gibt z.Z. sechs kanadische Mannschaften im NHL. Eis-Hockey Spielenbereiche bekannt als Hockeyeisbahnen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il hockey di ghiaccio ha cominciato nel Canada ed oggi attrae più giocatori e spectators che qualunque altro sport. Le leghe sono organizzate durante il paese. Il hockey professionale disegna i migliaia degli spectators alle grandi arene ed a milioni per guardare le loro televisioni. L'entusiasmo è alto alla conclusione della stagione, quando le due squadre migliori della lega nazionale del Hockey, conosciute più conunemente come il NHL, emergono da una serie di spareggi per competere per la tazza dello Stanley. Ci sono attualmente sei squadre canadesi nel NHL. Le gioc-zone del hockey di ghiaccio sono conosciute come rinks del hockey.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El hockey sobre hielo comenzó en Canadá, y atrae hoy a más jugadores y espectadores que cualquier otro deporte. Organizan a las ligas a través del país. El hockey profesional dibuja a millares de espectadores a las arenas grandes y a millones para mirar sus televisiones. El entusiasmo es alto en el final de la estación, cuando los dos mejores equipos de la liga nacional del hockey, conocidos más comunmente como el NHL, emergen de una serie de segundas fases para competir para la taza de Stanley. Hay actualmente seis equipos canadienses en el NHL. Las jugar-áreas del hockey sobre hielo se conocen como pistas del hockey.

TEXT.English: After the Turks conquered much of southern Hungary, a new defensive line inside the country was strongly needed. Out of castles, mansions, churches and monasteries a new defensive line was built with the efforts of the bondsmen of the surrounding area within a short time. A new system of castles was created, which began at the Adriatic Sea, ended at the lower Danube River and enclosed the area that was controlled by the Turks. The most important places were Kanizsa, Györ and Komárom, in the north Érsekújvár, Kassa, Szatmár and in the east Várad, Gyula, Lippa and Temesvár, these fortresses observed every Turkish movement. [PARAGRAPH:1]From the 1550s on, the Vienna council sent some military engineers to Hungary, that rebuilt the most important Végvárs to a modern standard. The most important functions of the Végvárs were to defend the borders, secure the roads and the river crossings, the prevention of the enemy troop supplies and the security of the people and their goods in the surrounding area. [PARAGRAPH:1]Towers were built from where the defenders could fire at the attacking enemies that wanted to climb the walls, whereas the defenders where protected from enemy bombardments. After 1556 the military council took control over the Végvárs, thus they were under a uniform and competent command. Furthermore, smart defenders invented new military equipment and in peaceful times the wine supply didn't only delight the castles crew. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.German: Nachdem die Türken sich in Ungarn einrichteten, wurde dringend eine neue Verteidigungslinie im Inneren des Landes benötigt. Aus Ritterburgen und Schlössern, Herrenhäusern, Kirchen und Klöstern wurde mit großen Anstrengungen seitens der Leibeigenen aus der Umgebung in kurzer Zeit eine neue Verteidigungslinie erschaffen. Ein komplettes Burgensystem entstand das beginnend an der Adria bis zur unteren Donau verlief und das von Türken besetzte Gebiet einschloss. Die bedeutendsten Orte waren Kanizsa, Gyor und Komárom; im Norden außerdem Érsekújvár, Kassa, Szatmár und im Osten Várad, Gyula, Lippa und Temesvár, welche jede türkische Bewegung überwachten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Ab Mitte der 1550er Jahre sandte der Wiener Rat einige italienische Militäringenieure nach Ungarn, die die wichtigsten Végvár gemäß den damaligen Ansprüchen umbauten. Die wichtigsten Aufgaben der Végvár waren die Verteidigung der Grenzen, die Sicherung der Straßen und der Flussübergänge, die Unterbindung des feindlichen Truppennachschubs und der Schutz der Bevölkerung der jeweiligen Umgebung und deren Eigentum. [PARAGRAPH:1]Aus den Mauerfluchten wurden schmucke fünfseitige Türme gebaut. Von dort aus konnten die Verteidiger die Angreifer die die Mauern erstürmen wollten, unter Feuer nehmen, sie selbst waren vor feindlichem Beschuss geschützt. Ab 1556 gerieten die Végvár unter die Kontrolle des Militärrates und damit eröffnete sich die Möglichkeit das Burgensystem unter ein einheitliches und fähiges Kommando zu stellen. Zudem erfanden einige gewiefte Verteidiger neue Kriegsmaschinerie und der Weinvorrat der Burgen erfreute in friedlicheren Zeiten nicht nur die Burgbesatzung. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Italian: Dopo che i turchi conquistarono larga parte dell'Ungheria meridionale si rese fortemente necessaria una nuova linea di difese sul territorio. Grazie agli sforzi dei vassalli delle aree vicine, in poco tempo ne fu costruita una che correva esternamente alle dimore dei cavalieri e dei signori, ai castelli, alle chiese e ai monasteri. La nuova linea difensiva era costituita da una serie di castelli che partiva dal mar Adriatico e terminava sulle rive del basso Danubio, delimitando cosi il territorio controllato dai turchi. Le postazioni piu importanti furono Kanizsa, Györ e Komárom, a nord Érsekújvár, Kassa e Szatmár e ad est Várad, Gyula, Lippa e Temesvár; da queste fortezze era possibile tenere sotto controllo tutti i movimenti delle truppe turche. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dalla meta del XVI secolo, il consiglio di Vienna invio in Ungheria alcuni ingegneri militari che ristrutturarono i piu importanti végvár secondo standard moderni. Le funzioni piu importanti dei vegvár furono di sorvegliare i confini, di garantire un passaggio sicuro sulle strade e sul fiume, di intercettare i rifornimenti delle truppe nemiche e di difendere la popolazione e i loro beni nelle aree circostanti. [PARAGRAPH:1]Furono edificate delle torri da cui i soldati posti a difesa, ben protetti dai bombardamenti nemici, potevano far fuoco sui soldati che cercavano di arrampicarsi lungo le mura. Dopo il 1556 il consiglio militare prese il controllo dei végvár che, di conseguenza, furono amministrati da un comando uniforme e competente. Inoltre, dei soldati brillanti inventarono un nuovo equipaggiamento militare mentre in tempo di pace le abbondanti risorse di vino non deliziarono unicamente gli abitanti dei castelli.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Huns were a confederation of nomadic pastoralist people who, appearing from beyond the Volga, invaded Europe c. AD 370 and built up an enormous empire in Eurasia. They kept herds of cattle, horses, goats, and sheep as sources as food, as well as resources for clothing and other materials.

[TAB]The Indonesian Archipelago, home of the Spice Islands, has been an important trade destination since ancient times, when early Chinese sailors began to find profit in the spice trade. Much of Indonesia's history has been influenced by the many foreign powers that have been drawn to the archipelago and by its wealth of natural resources. Spice Islands most commonly refers to the Maluku Islands (formerly the Moluccas), which lie on the equator, between Sulawesi (Celebes) and the New Guinea islands in what is now Indonesia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Until the late 18th century, the Moluccas were the only source of economically significant spices, including clove, nutmeg and mace. Archaeological and linguistic evidence places Spice Island traders within a trading circuit reaching as far as mainland India around 200 BC. Pliny, the Roman author, described cloves not long afterwards. Javanese and Chinese merchants were heavily involved in the spice trade, and spices reached Europe only after passing through many foreign hands, with the main western terminus of the trade at Alexandria in Egypt.

[TAB]Iranian Mines and Mining Industries Development and Renovation Organization (IMIDRO) is a major holding company active in the mining sector in Iran. IMIDRO has 8 major companies and 55 operational subsidiaries active in steel, aluminum, copper, cement and mineral exploitation fields.Due to diversifying its oil-based economy, and the current sanctions against Iran, Iran has developed its biotechnology, nanotechnology, and pharmaceuticals industries.

[TAB]Because of the archaeological riches of Mesopotamia, its collections are amongst the most important in the world; and it has a fine record of scholarship and display. The British connection with the museum (and with Iraq) means that exhibits have always been displayed bilingually (English and Arabic). It contains important artifacts from the over 5,000 year long history of Mesopotamia in 28 galleries and vaults.

[TAB]Hundreds of years ago, the followers of the Catholic religion in Italy started the tradition of holding a wild costume festival right before the first day of Lent. Because Catholics are not supposed to eat meat during Lent, they called their festival, carnevale - which means "to put away the meat". As time passed, carnivals in Italy became quite famous; and in fact the practice spread to France, Spain, and all the Catholic countries in Europe. Then as the French, Spanish, and Portuguese began to take control of the Americas and other parts of the world, they brought with them their tradition of celebrating carnival.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[TAB]Kanem-Bornu under Aluma was strong and wealthy. Government revenue came from tribute (or booty, if the recalcitrant people had to be conquered), sales of slaves, and duties on and participation in trans-Saharan trade. Unlike West Africa, the Chadian region did not have gold. Still, it was central to one of the most convenient trans-Saharan routes. Between Lake Chad and Fezzan lay a sequence of well-spaced wells and oases, and from Fezzan there were easy connections to North Africa and the Mediterranean Sea. Many products were sent north, including natron (sodium carbonate), cotton, kola nuts, ivory, ostrich feathers, perfume, wax, and hides, but the most important of all were slaves. Imports included salt, horses, silks, glass, muskets, and copper.

[TAB]Because livestock was central to the Kazakhs' traditional lifestyle, most of their nomadic practices and customs relate in some way to livestock. Kazakhs have historically been very affectionate about horse-riding. Traditional curses and blessings invoked disease or fecundity among animals, and good manners required that a person ask first about the health of a man's livestock when greeting him and only afterward inquire about the human aspects of his life. Even today, many Kazakhs express interest in equestrianism and horse-racing. In the national cuisine, livestock meat can be cooked in a variety of ways and is usually served with a wide assortment of traditional bread products. Refreshments often include black tea and traditional milk-derived drinks such as ayran, shubat and kymyz. A traditional Kazakh dinner involves a multitude of appetisers on the table, followed by a soup and one or two main courses such as pilaf and beshbarmak. They also drink their national beverage, which consists of fermented mare's milk.

The Kotel, or Western Wall, in Jerusalem is the holiest of Jewish sites. It is so sacred, because it is the remnant of the Herodian wall that enclosed and supported the Second Temple. It is also called the Wailing Wall because for centuries, Jews have gathered at the wall to mourn the loss of their temple. [PARAGRAPH:1] The Western Wall was built by King Herod in 20 BC during his expansion of the Temple. The construction took 11 years. In 70 AD, the Romans destroyed Jerusalem and the Temple. All that remained of the Temple, was the wall. During the Ottoman Period, the wall became the Jews chief place of travel, where they came to grieve the destruction of the temple. [PARAGRAPH:1] For centuries, the Western Wall was located in a narrow ally, and could hold only a few hundred worshipers. But, in 1967, after the Six Day War, Israelis created the Western Wall Plaza, which can accommodate tens of thousands of worshippers. Another improvement made to the wall, was that the wall was made six and a half feet higher by digging down and exposing two more of the stones from the retaining wall. This area was covered by debris for centuries.
TEXT.French: Le Kotel, ou le mur occidental, à Jérusalem est le plus saint des emplacements juifs. Il est si sacré, parce que c'est le reste du mur de Herodian qui inclus et soutenu le deuxième temple. Ce s'appelle également le mur pleurant parce que pendant des siècles, les juifs se sont réunis au mur pour pleurer la perte de leur temple. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Le mur occidental a été construit par le Roi Herod dans 20 AVANT JÉSUS CHRIST pendant son expansion du temple. La construction a pris 11 ans. Dans l'ANNONCE 70, le Romans a détruit Jérusalem et le temple. Tout ce qui est resté du temple, était le mur. Pendant la période de tabouret, le mur place en chef est allé bien à juifs' de voyage, où ils sont venus pour s'affliger la destruction du temple. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Pendant des siècles, le mur occidental a été situé dans un allié étroit, et a pu tenir seulement quelques cent worshipers. Mais, en 1967, après la guerre de six jours, les Israéliens ont créé la plaza occidentale de mur, qui peut adapter à des dizaines de milliers d'adorateurs. Une autre amélioration apportée au mur, était que le mur a été fait six des pieds et demi plus de haut en creusant vers le bas et en exposant deux davantage des pierres à partir du mur de soutènement. Ce domaine a été couvert par des débris pendant des siècles.
TEXT.German: Das Kotel oder die westliche Wand, in Jerusalem ist der jüdischen Aufstellungsorte das heiligste. Es ist so heilig, weil es der Rest der Herodian Wand ist, die beiliegend und gestützt dem zweiten Bügel. Es wird auch die Klagemauer genannt, weil für Jahrhunderte, Juden an der Wand erfaßt haben, um den Verlust ihres Bügels zu beklagen. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Die westliche Wand wurde vom König Herod in 20 BC während seiner Expansion des Bügels errichtet. Der Aufbau dauerte 11 Jahre. In ANZEIGE 70 zerstörte das Romans Jerusalem und den Bügel. Alle, die vom Bügel blieb, war die Wand. Während der Ottoman-Periode stand die Wand Hauptort der Juden' des Spielraums, wohin sie kamen, sich die Zerstörung des Bügels Sorgen zu machen. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Für Jahrhunderte war die westliche Wand in einem schmalen Verbündeten und konnte nur einige hundert Anbetern halten. Aber, 1967, nach dem sechstägigen Krieg, stellten Israelis die westliche Wand-Piazza her, die 10 Tausenden worshippers unterbringen kann. Eine andere Verbesserung, die zur Wand gebildet wurde, war, daß die Wand sechs und eine Hälfte die Füße höher gebildet wurde, indem man unten grub und mehr zwei der Steine von der Stützmauer herausstellte. Dieser Bereich wurde durch Rückstand für Jahrhunderte umfaßt.
TEXT.Italian: Il Kotel, o la parete occidentale, a Gerusalemme è il più santo dei luoghi ebrei. È così sacred, perché è il resto della parete di Herodian che incluso e sostenuto il secondo tempiale. Inoltre è denominato la parete lamentantesi perché per i secoli, gli ebrei hanno riunito alla parete per addolorarsi la perdita del loro tempiale. [PARAGRAPH: 1] La parete occidentale è stata costruita BC dal re Herod in 20 durante la sua espansione del tempiale. La costruzione ha occorr 11 anno. In ANNUNCIO 70, il Romans ha distrutto Gerusalemme ed il tempiale. Tutta che rimanesse del tempiale, era la parete. Durante il periodo del Ottoman, la parete ha stato bene posto principale agli ebrei' della corsa, in cui sono venuto addolorarsi la distruzione del tempiale. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Per i secoli, la parete occidentale è stata situata in un alleato stretto ed ha potuto tenere soltanto alcuni cento worshipers. Ma, in 1967, dopo la guerra di sei giorni, gli israeliani hanno generato il Plaza occidentale della parete, che può accomodare i dieci delle migliaia dei worshippers. Un altro miglioramento apportato alla parete, era che la parete è stata fatta sei e piedi di metà più d'altezza scavando giù ed esponendo due più delle pietre dal muro di sostegno. Questo settore è stato trattato tramite residui per i secoli.
TEXT.Spanish: El Kotel, o la pared occidental, en Jerusalén es los más santos de sitios judíos. Es tan sagrada, porque es el remanente de la pared de Herodian que incluido y apoyado el segundo templo. También se llama la pared que se lamenta porque por siglos, los judíos han recolectado en la pared para estar de luto la pérdida de su templo. [PARAGRAPH: 1] La pared occidental fue construida por rey Herod en 20 A.C. durante su extensión del templo. La construcción tomó 11 años. En el ANUNCIO 70, el Romans destruyó Jerusalén y el templo. Toda que permanecía del templo, era la pared. Durante el período del otomano, la pared sintió bien principal lugar de los judíos el' del recorrido, adonde vinieron afligirse la destrucción del templo. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Por siglos, la pared occidental fue situada en un aliado estrecho, y podía sostener solamente a algunos cientos worshipers. Pero, en 1967, después de la guerra de seis días, los israelíes crearon la plaza occidental de la pared, que puede acomodar diez de millares de devotos. Otra mejora llevada a cabo a la pared, era que la pared fue hecha seises y los pies de una mitad más altos cavando abajo y exponiendo dos más de las piedras del muro de contención. Esta área fue cubierta por la ruina por siglos.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A Kurgan is the Turkish word for burial mound or tumulus. The word Kurgan is used to describe a burial mound used in the Bronze-Middle ages in Russia, in some parts of Europe. Kurgans were used mostly throughout central Asia and Russia, around where the Khazar Empire thrived.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un Kurgan est le mot turc pour le monticule ou le tumulus d'enterrement. Le mot Kurgan est employé pour décrire un monticule d'enterrement utilisé dans les âges Bronze-Moyens en Russie, dans quelques parties de l'Europe. Kurgans ont été employés la plupart du temps dans l'ensemble de l'Asie centrale et de la Russie, autour d'où l'empire de Khazar a prospéré.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Kurgan ist das türkische Wort für Grabhügel oder tumulus. Das Wort Kurgan wird verwendet, um einen Grabhügel zu beschreiben, der im Bronze-Mittleren Alter in Rußland, in einigen Teilen von Europa benutzt wird. Kurgans wurden meistens in zentralem Asien und Rußland, verwendet um, dem das Khazar Reich vorwärtskam.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un Kurgan è la parola turca per il monticello di sepoltura o il tumulus. La parola Kurgan è usata per descrivere un monticello di sepoltura usato nelle età Bronzo-Centrali in Russia, in alcune parti di Europa. Kurgans è stato usato principalmente durante l'Asia centrale e la Russia, intorno a dove l'impero di Khazar ha prosperato.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un Kurgan es la palabra turca para el montón de entierro o el tumulus. La palabra Kurgan se utiliza para describir un montón de entierro usado en las edades Bronce-Medias en Rusia, en algunas partes de Europa. Kurgans fue utilizado sobre todo a través de Asia central y de Rusia, alrededor de donde prosperó el imperio de Khazar.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Although stereotyped in the West as nomads, most Berbers were in fact traditionally farmers, living in the mountains relatively close to the Mediterranean coast, or oasis dwellers; the Tuareg and Zenaga of the southern Sahara, however, were nomadic. Some groups, such as the Chaouis, practiced transhumance. Traditional transhumance is the seasonal movement of livestock, ascending to mountain pastures in summer and descending to relatively warm areas in the valleys or desert fringe in winter. Transhumance is based on the difference of climate between the mountains (where the herds stay during the summer) and the lowlands (where they remain the winter). Its importance to pastoralist societies cannot be overstated. Milk, butter and cheese - the products of transhumance - often form the basis of the local population's diet.

[TAB]The main event of the Majapahit administrative calendar took place on the first day of the month of Caitra (March-April) when representatives from all territories paying tax or tribute to Majapahit came to the capital to pay court. Majapahit's territories were roughly divided into three types: the palace and its vicinity; the areas of east Java and Bali which were directly administrated by officials appointed by the king; and the outer dependencies which enjoyed substantial internal autonomy.

[TAB]Salegy is the best-known and most widely exported dance pop music of Madagascar. It began in northern coastal towns like Majunga, Nosy Be and Diego Suarez (Antsiranana). Salegy is driving, 12/8 music with clear affinities to mainland Afropop styles in places like Zimbabwe and Mozambique. It is characterized by gently rippling guitar work, organ or keyboards and sometimes accordion, and powerful vocal armonies.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The style originated with Malagasy folk songs, often sung during moonlight feasts. But as in the birth sagas of so many 20th century roots pop styles, pioneering musicians also needed to get an education in foreign music. As international pop styles, and music technology seeped into this remote, local scene, salegy pop emerged, and was being widely recorded by the 1950s and 60s. It evolved to feature rich, harmonized vocals and chiming guitar lines locked, restless, animated 12/8 rhythms. There is also a calmer, more romantic genre of the music, known as malesa.

[TAB]The Poro, or Purrah or Purroh, is a secret society of Sierra Leone and Liberia. The Poro has its special ritual and language, tattooing and symbols, but details are scarce, due to an oath of secrecy. It meets usually in the dry season, between the months of October and May. The rendezvous is in the bush, at an enclosure, separated into apartments by mats and roofed only by the overhanging trees, serving as a club-house. There are three grades, the first for chiefs and big men, the second for fetish-priests and the third for the crowd. The ceremonies of the Purrah are presided over by the Poro devil, a man in fetish dress, who addresses the meeting through a long tube of wood.

[TAB]Toqui (Mapudungun for axe or axe-bearer) is a title conferred by the Mapuche (an indigenous Chilean people) to those who are chosen as their leaders during times of war. The toqui is chosen in an assembly or parliament (coyag), of the chiefs (loncos) of the various clans (Rehues) or confederation of clans (Aillarehues), allied during the war in question. The Toqui could command strict obedience of all the warriors and their loncos during the war, organize them in units and appoint leaders over them. This command would continue until toqui was killed, deposed in another parliament (as in the case of Lincoyan, for poor leadership), or upon completion of the war for which he was chosen. Some of the more famous Toqui in the Arauco War with the Spanish introduced tactical innovations; for instance, Lautaro introduced infantry tactics to defeat horsemen. Lemucaguin was the first Toqui to use firearms and artillery in battle. Nongoniel was the first Toqui to use cavalry with the Mapuche army. Cadeguala was the first to successfully use Mapuche cavarly to defeat Spanish cavalry in battle. Anganamón was the first to mount his infantry to keep up with his fast moving cavalry. Lientur pioneered the tactic of numerous and rapid malóns into Spanish territory.

[TAB]A marae is a sacred place which served for both religious and social purposes in pre-Christian Polynesian societies. In all Polynesian languages, any variant of this word means "cleared, free of weeds, trees, etc." It generally consists of an area of cleared land roughly rectangular, bordered with stones or wooded posts. In the Maori of New Zealand, the marae is still a vital part of everyday life. However, in most other Polynesian societies, most marae were destroyed or abandoned with the arrival of Christianity. Despite all this, marae were built and still considered as a holy place and nobody would build on it. [PARAGRAPH: 1] In Maori society, the marae is a place where the culture can be celebrated. Various intertribal ceremonies were also practiced in the marae. In Maori usage, marae is technically the enclosed space in front of a meeting house. However, it is usually used to describe the marae itself and the surrounded complex. The meeting house is the setting for important meetings, sleepovers, and craft and cultural activities. The wharakeai, dining hall, is sued primarily for communal meals. Many of the words associated with marae in tropical Polynesia are kept in the Maori context.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Un marae est un lieu sacré qui servait à la fois pour des raisons sociales et religieuses dans le préprimaire Christian sociétés polynésiennes. Dans toutes les langues polynésiennes, une variante de ce mot signifie "nettoyés, exempts de mauvaises herbes, les arbres, etc" Elle est généralement constituée d'une zone de terres déminées à peu près rectangulaire, bordés de pierres ou d'arbres postes. Dans les Maori de la Nouvelle-Zélande, les marae est toujours une partie essentielle de la vie quotidienne. Toutefois, dans la plupart des autres sociétés polynésiennes, la plupart des marae ont été détruits ou abandonnés avec l'arrivée du christianisme. Malgré tout cela, marae ont été construits et toujours considéré comme un lieu saint et personne ne s'appuierait sur elle. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Dans la société maorie, les marae est un lieu où la culture peut être célébré. Diverses cérémonies intertribaux ont également été pratiquée dans les marae. En Maoris utilisation, marae est techniquement un espace clos devant une réunion de maison. Cependant, il est souvent utilisé pour décrire les marae lui-même et le milieu complexe. La réunion maison est le cadre de réunions importantes, sleepovers, et de l'artisanat et des activités culturelles. Le wharakeai, réfectoire, est poursuivi principalement pour des repas communaux. Beaucoup des mots associés à marae en Polynésie tropicales sont conservées dans le contexte des Maoris.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Ein marae ist ein heiliger Ort, der für beide serviert religiösen und sozialen Zwecken in der vorchristlichen polynesischen Gesellschaften. In allen polynesischen Sprachen, jede Variante dieses Wort bedeutet "geräumt, frei von Unkraut, Bäume, usw." Es besteht aus einem allgemeinen Bereich der geräumten Flächen rund rechteckig, grenzt mit Steinen oder bewaldeten Stellen. In den Maori in Neuseeland, die marae ist nach wie vor ein wesentlicher Bestandteil des täglichen Lebens. Aber auch in den meisten anderen polynesischen Gesellschaften, die meisten marae wurden zerstört oder aufgegeben mit der Ankunft des Christentums. Trotz all dieser marae gebaut wurden und noch immer als ein heiliger Ort, und niemand würde auf sie. [ABSATZ: 1] In Maori Gesellschaft, die marae ist ein Ort, wo die Kultur gefeiert werden kann. Verschiedene intertribal Zeremonien wurden auch geübt in der marae. In Maori Nutzung, marae ist technisch der geschlossenen Raum vor der Sitzung. Allerdings ist es in der Regel zur Beschreibung der marae selbst und der umgeben komplex. Die Sitzung ist die Einstellung für den wichtigen Sitzungen, sleepovers, und handwerklichen und kulturellen Aktivitäten. Die wharakeai, Speiseraum, verklagt ist in erster Linie für gemeinsames Essen. Viele der Wörter im Zusammenhang mit marae in tropischen Polynesien werden in der Maori.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Un marae è un luogo sacro, che è servita sia per scopi religiosi e sociali nel pre- cristiano Polinesia società. In tutte le lingue della Polinesia, qualsiasi variante di questa parola significa ", però, la libera di erbacce, alberi, ecc" Essa consiste in genere di una zona di terra eliminato circa rettangolare, confinante con pietre o boschive post. Nel Maori della Nuova Zelanda, il marae è ancora una parte vitale della vita quotidiana. Tuttavia, nella maggior parte delle altre società polinesiana, la maggior parte marae sono state distrutte o abbandonate con l'arrivo del cristianesimo. Nonostante tutto questo, marae sono stati costruiti e ancora considerato come un luogo sacro, e nessuno potrebbe costruire su di essa. [PARAGRAFO: 1] Nel Maori società, il marae è un luogo in cui la cultura può essere celebrato. Diversi intertribal cerimonie sono state praticate anche nel marae. In Maori uso, marae è tecnicamente il spazio chiuso di fronte a una riunione casa. Tuttavia, è di solito usato per descrivere la marae stesso e circondato il complesso. La riunione casa è l'impostazione di riunioni importanti, sleepovers, e artigianali e le attività culturali. Il wharakeai, sala da pranzo, è citato in primo luogo per i pasti in comune. Molte delle parole associate con marae nella Polinesia tropicali sono conservate nel contesto Maori.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Una marae es un lugar sagrado, que sirve tanto para fines religiosos y sociales en los polinesios antes de las sociedades cristianas. En todos los idiomas polinesios, cualquier variante de esta palabra significa "limpia, libre de malezas, árboles, etc" Generalmente consta de un área de terreno despejado, aproximadamente rectangulares, bordeado con piedras o arbolado puestos. En los maoríes de Nueva Zelandia, el marae sigue siendo una parte vital de la vida cotidiana. Sin embargo, en la mayoría de las otras sociedades de Polinesia, la mayoría de marae fueron destruidos o abandonados con la llegada del cristianismo. A pesar de todo esto, marae se construyeron y aún considerado como un lugar sagrado y nadie puede construir sobre ella. [APARTADO: 1] En la sociedad maorí, el marae es un lugar donde la cultura puede ser celebrado. Varios intertribales ceremonias también se practica en los marae. En uso de los maoríes, es técnicamente el marae espacio cerrado delante de una casa de reunión. Sin embargo, es generalmente utilizado para describir el mismo y el marae rodeado complejo. En la reunión se casa es el escenario de importantes reuniones, sleepovers, y en la artesanía y las actividades culturales. El wharakeai, comedor, es demandado principalmente para las comidas comunales. Muchas de las palabras asociadas con marae tropicales en la Polinesia se mantienen en el contexto maoríes.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The megaron was the "Great Hall" in Minoan-Mycenaean society. It was used for many purposes, including poetry, feasts, worshipping gods, sacrifice, and counsels of war. A famous megaron is the reception hall of the king in the Palace of Tyrins. The megaron is a rectangular hall with a two-collumned porch.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le megaron était le « grand Hall » dans la société de Minoan-Mycenaean. Il a été employé pour beaucoup de buts, y compris la poésie, régals, dieux adorants, sacrifice, et avocats-conseils de guerre. Un megaron célèbre est le hall de réception du roi dans le palais de Tyrins. Le megaron est un hall rectangulaire avec a two-collumned le porche.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das megaron war der große Hall in der Minoan-Mycenaean Gesellschaft. Es wurde für viele Zwecke, einschließlich Poesie, Feste, anbetende Götter, Opfer und Ratschläge des Krieges verwendet. Ein berühmtes megaron ist die Aufnahmehalle des Königs im Palast von Tyrins. Das megaron ist eine rechteckige Halle mit a two-collumned Portal.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il megaron era il Corridoio grande nella società di Minoan-Mycenaean. È stato usato per molti scopi, compreso la poesia, le festività, i dii d'adorazione, il sacrificio ed i consulenti legali della guerra. Un megaron famoso è il corridoio di ricezione del re nel palazzo di Tyrins. Il megaron è un corridoio rettangolare con la a two-collumned il portico.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El megaron era el gran Pasillo en la sociedad de Minoan-Mycenaean. Fue utilizado para muchos propósitos, incluyendo poesía, los banquetes, los dioses que se adoraban, el sacrificio, y los consejos de la guerra. Un megaron famoso es el pasillo de la recepción del rey en el palacio de Tyrins. El megaron es un pasillo rectangular con a two-collumned el pórtico.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Jean François Champollion and Ippolito Rosellini were some of the first Egyptologists of wide acclaim. The German Karl Richard Lepsius was an early participant in the investigations of Egypt; mapping, excavating, and recording several sites. Champollion announced his general decipherment of the system of Egyptian hieroglyphics for the first time, employing the Rosetta Stone as his primary aid. The Stone's decipherment was a very important development of Egyptology. With subsequently ever-increasing knowledge of Egyptian writing and language, the study of Ancient Egyptian civilisation was able to proceed with greater academic rigour and with all the added impetus that comprehension of the written sources was able to engender. Egyptology became more professional via work of William Matthew Flinders Petrie, among others. Petrie introduced techniques of field preservation, recording, and excavating. Howard Carter's expedition brought much acclaim to the field of Egyptology.Around 1830, Rifa'a el-Tahtawi was one of the first main scholars of Egyptian Egyptology. He was inspired by the work of Muslim Egyptologists in medieval Egypt, though modern Egyptian Egyptology developed slowly compared to its Western scholars, primarily because of Islamic identity. Islamic and modern Egyptian civilization has been influenced by the pre-Islamic Egyptian culture with which Egyptology is concerned.In the Modern era, the Supreme Council for Antiquities control excavation permits for Egyptologists to conduct their work. The field can now use geophysical methods and other applications of modern sensing techniques to further Egyptology. The Egyptian languages (such as Hieratics and Coptic) and the Egyptian writing systems are still of importance in Egyptology.

[TAB]The Cham Empire was a religious empire, and built many temples. A common feature of these temples is that there are towers, or menaras, in these temples. The most famous temples of the Cham are the temples at My Son. Other temples with towers are Po Klaung, Po Nagar, and Pho Hai. In the village of Khuong My in the Vietnamese province of Quang Nam stands a group of three Cham towers dating from the 10th century. [PARAGRAPH: 1] The Po Nagar towers once stood at the entrance to a river. The Po Nagar towers complex was built between the 7th and 12th century. The most beautiful towers were built in the year 813 and 817. Most were destroyed and only four towers are still standing. Each tower is a shrine to a different deity. There are eight towers at Binh Dinh which are commonly used to study Champa.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'empire de Cham était un empire religieux, et a construit beaucoup de temples. Un dispositif commun de ces temples est qu'il y a des tours dans des ces temples. Les temples les plus célèbres du Cham sont les temples à mon fils. D'autres temples avec des tours sont PO Klaung, PO Nagar, et Pho Hai. Dans le village de Khuong mon dedans la province vietnamienne de Quang Nam tient un groupe de trois tours de Cham datant du 10ème siècle. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Le PO Nagar domine une fois tenu à l'entrée à un fleuve. Le complexe de tours de PO Nagar a été établi entre le 7ème et 12ème siècle. Les tours les plus belles ont été construites en l'année 813 et 817. Les la plupart ont été détruites et seulement quatre tours se tiennent toujours. Chaque tour est un tombeau à une déité différente. Il y a huit tours chez Binh Dinh qui sont utilisées généralement pour étudier Champa.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das cham-Reich war ein frommes Reich und errichtete viele Bügel. Eine allgemeine Eigenschaft dieser Bügel ist, daß es Aufsätze in diesen Bügeln gibt. Die berühmtesten Bügel des Cham sind die Bügel an meinem Sohn. Andere Bügel mit Aufsätzen sind PO Klaung, PO Nagar und Pho Hai. Im Dorf von Khuong meinem innen steht die vietnamesische Provinz von Quang Nam eine Gruppe von drei Chamaufsätzen, die vom 10. Jahrhundert datieren. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Das PO Nagar towers einmal gestanden am Eingang zu einem Fluß. Der PO Nagar Aufsatzkomplex wurde zwischen dem 7. und 12. Jahrhundert errichtet. Die schönsten Aufsätze wurden im Jahr 813 und 817 errichtet. Die meisten wurden zerstört und nur vier Aufsätze stehen noch. Jeder Aufsatz ist ein Schrein zu einer anderen Gottheit. Es gibt acht Aufsätze bei Binh Dinh, die allgemein verwendet sind, Champa zu studieren.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'impero del Cham era un impero religioso ed ha costruito molte tempie. Una caratteristica comune di queste tempie è che ci sono torrette in queste tempie. Le tempie più famose del Cham sono le tempie al mio figlio. Altre tempie con le torrette sono Po Klaung, Po Nagar e Pho Hai. Nel villaggio di Khuong mio dentro la provincia vietnamita di Quang Nam si leva in piedi un gruppo di tre torrette del Cham che datano dal decimo secolo. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Il Po Nagar torreggia su levato in piedi una volta all'entrata ad un fiume. Il complesso delle torrette di Po Nagar è stato sviluppato fra il settimo e dodicesimo secolo. Le torrette più belle sono state costruite durante gli anni 813 e 817. La maggior parte sono stati distrutti e soltanto quattro torrette ancora stanno levando in piedi. Ogni torretta è uno shrine ad un deity differente. Ci sono otto torrette a Binh Dinh che sono comunemente usate studiare Champa.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El imperio del Cham era un imperio religioso, y construyó muchos templos. Una característica común de estos templos es que hay torres en estos templos. Los templos más famosos del Cham son los templos en mi hijo. Otros templos con las torres son Po Klaung, Po Nagar, y Pho Hai. En la aldea de Khuong mi adentro la provincia vietnamita de Quang Nam está parado un grupo de tres torres del Cham que fechan a partir del 10mo siglo. [PARAGRAPH: 1] El Po Nagar se eleva estado parado una vez en la entrada a un río. El complejo de las torres del Po Nagar fue construido entre el 7mo y 12mo siglo. Las torres más hermosas fueron construidas en el año 813 y 817. La mayoría fueron destruidas y solamente cuatro torres todavía están estando paradas. Cada torre es una capilla a un diverso deity. Hay ocho torres en Binh Dinh que son de uso general estudiar Champa.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A charreada is a Mexican-style rodeo that is different from other rodeos. The Mexican cowboy or cowgirl is known as a charro or charra. In an American rodeo the competitors race against the clock, so the emphasis is on speed in any given event. On the other hand, in a Mexican charreada the excellent style and skills of the rider or roper are emphasized, and only one event is timed.[PARAGRAPH:1]Charrería (a word encompassing all aspects of the art) came to Mexico from Salamanca, Spain, in the 16th century. Interesting is the fact that when the Spaniards first settled in Mexico they were under the orders of the ruler to raise horses, but not to allow the Mexicans to ride them. By 1528 the Spaniards had very large cattle-raising estates. They soon found it necessary to employ the Mexicans as vaqueros or herdsman, and the natives soon became excellent horsemen. Small landholders, known as rancheros or ranchers, were the first genuine charros and invented charreadas.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[TAB]The Minoans are perhaps most known for their huge palaces (Anaktoras). While it was believed that all of these palaces were built in the Middle Minoan period around 2000 BC, it have later been proved that this is not the case and that the palace at Malia were built as early as the third millennium BC in the Early Minoan period. The three main old palaces were the ones at Malia, Knossos and Phaistos. These palaces had a number of functions, such as centers of government, administrative offices, shrines, workshops, and storage spaces. This have created a discussion if it really is right to call these buildings palaces, and the term court building have been suggested instead. However, the original term is probably too well entrenched to be replaced.[PARAGRAPH:1]Often the conventions of better-known, younger palaces have been used to reconstruct older ones, but this practice may be obscuring fundamental functional differences. Most older palaces had only one story and no representative facades. They were U-shaped, with a big central court, and generally were smaller than later palaces. Late palaces are characterised by multi-story buildings. The west facades had sandstone ashlar masonry. Knossos is the best-known example. See Knossos. Further building conventions could include storage magazines, a north-south orientation, a pillar room, a Minoan Hall system, a western court, and pier-and-door entrance ways. Palatial architecture in the First Palace Period is identified by its 'square within a square' style, whilst later, Second Palace Period constructions incorporated more internal divisions and corridors.[PARAGRAPH:1]It is a common architectural standard among the Middle Minoan 'palaces' that they are aligned with their surrounding topography. The MM palatial structure of Phaistos appears to align with Mount Ida, whilst Knossos is aligned with Juktas. These are oriented along a north-south axis. One suggested reason for this is the ritual significance of the mountain, where a number of Peak Sanctuaries have been excavated like Petsophas. The material record for these sites show clusters of clay figurines and evidence of animal sacrifice.[PARAGRAPH:1](Wikipedia: Minoan Civilization)

[TAB]In Quechua, a Native American language of South America, a huaca or wak'a is an object that represents something revered, typically a monument of some kind. The term huaca can refer to natural locations, such as immense rocks. Some huacas have been associated with veneration and ritual. Andean cultures believed every object has a physical presence and two camaquen (spirits), one to create it and another to animate it. They would invoke its spirits for the object to function.[PARAGRAPH:1] The term 'huaca' is often associated with pyramids and temples in Moche culture. Impressive ziggurats can be found in a number of Moche sites.

[TAB]The word "Zimbabwe" could be a short form for "ziimba remabwe" or "ziimba rebwe", a Shona term, which means "the great or big house built of stone boulders". In the Karanga dialect of the Shona language, "imba" means "a house" or "a building" and "ziimba", or "zimba", mean "a huge/big building or house". A second theory is that Zimbabwe is a contracted form of "dzimba woye" which means "venerated houses" in the Zezuru dialect of the Shona language. This term is usually reserved for chiefs' houses or graves.

[TAB]Shearing sheds (or wool sheds) are large sheds located on sheep stations to accommodate large scale sheep shearing activities. In countries where large numbers of sheep are kept for wool, sometimes many thousands in a flock, shearing sheds are vital to house the necessary shearing equipment, and to ensure that the shearers and /or crutchers have a ready supply of dry, empty sheep. The shed also provides space where the wool is classed and pressed into approved wool packs and stored to await transport to market.

[TAB]The music of Nigeria includes many kinds of folk and popular music, some of which are known worldwide. Styles of folk music are related to the multitudes of ethnic groups in the country, each with their own techniques, instruments, and songs. JuJu is a style of Nigerian popular music, derived from traditional Yoruba percussion. This music, unlike apala, sakara, and fuji, was not created by Muslim Yoruba, and is therefore secular. JuJu music is performed primarily by artists from the southwestern region of Nigeria, where the Yoruba are the most numerous ethnic group. In performance, audience members commonly shower JuJu musicians with paper money; this tradition is known as "spraying."

[TAB]Beside oil, gas, and income from the merchant fleet, stockfish is Norway's longest sustained export commodity, and the socioeconomically most profitable export over the centuries. Stockfish is unsalted fish, especially cod, dried by sun and wind on wooden racks on the foreshore called flakes, or in special drying houses. The drying of food is the world's oldest known preservation method, and dried fish has a storage life of several years. The method is cheap and effective in suitable climates, the work can be done by the fisherman and family, and the resulting product is easily transported to market. Cod is the most common fish used in stockfish production, while other whitefish, such as pollock, haddock, ling and tusk, are used to a lesser degree. Over the centuries, several variants of stockfish have evolved, notably salt cod. Salting was not economically feasible before the 17th century, when cheap salt from southern Europe became available to the maritime nations of northern Europe.

[TAB]The best-recognized aspect of the Olmec civilzation are the enormous helmeted heads. As no known pre-Columbian text explains these, these impressive monuments have been the subject of much speculation. Once theorized to be ballplayers, it is now generally accepted that these heads are portraits of rulers. According to archaeologist David Grove, the unique elements in the headgear can also be recognized in headdresses of human figures on other Gulf Coast monuments, suggesting that these are personal or group symbols. The heads range in size from the Rancho La Cobata head, at 3.4 m high, to the pair at Tres Zapotes, at 1.47 m. It has been calculated that the largest heads weigh more than 20 tons.

[TAB]The Directorate for Inter-Services Intelligence (more commonly known as Inter-Services Intelligence or simply by its initials ISI) is Pakistan's premier intelligence agency. It is the largest of the three intelligence agencies of Pakistan, the other being the Intelligence Bureau (IB) and Military Intelligence (MI). ISI was established as an independent intelligence agency in 1948 in order to strengthen the sharing of military intelligence between the three branches of Pakistan's armed forces in the aftermath of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1947, which had exposed weaknesses in intelligence gathering, sharing and coordination between the Pakistan Army, Air Force and Navy. ISI's headquarters are situated in Islamabad. It is currently headed by Lieutenant General Ahmad Shuja Pasha, who took over as ISI's Director in September 2008.After independence in 1947, two new intelligence agencies were created in Pakistan: the Intelligence Bureau (IB) and the Military Intelligence (MI). However, the weak performance of the MI in sharing intelligence between the Army, Navy and Air Force during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1947 led to the creation of the Directorate for Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) in 1948. The ISI was structured to be manned by officers from the three main military services, and to specialize in the collection, analysis and assessment of external intelligence, either military or non-military. The ISI was the brainchild of Australian-born British Army officer, Major General R. Cawthome, then Deputy Chief of Staff in the Pakistan Army. Initially, the ISI had no role in the collection of internal intelligence, with the exception of the North-West Frontier Province and Azad Kashmir. In the late 1950s, when Ayub Khan became the President of Pakistan, he expanded the role of ISI in monitoring opposition politicians, and sustaining military rule in Pakistan. The ISI was reorganised in 1966 after intelligence failures in the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965, and expanded in 1969. Khan entrusted the ISI with the responsibility for the collection of internal political intelligence in East Pakistan. Later on, during the Baloch nationalist revolt in Balochistan in the mid-1970s, the ISI was tasked with performing a similar intelligence gathering operation. The ISI lost its importance during the regime of Zulfiqar Ali Bhutto, who was very critical of its role during the 1970 general elections, which triggered off the events leading to the partition of Pakistan and emergence of Bangladesh. After General Zia ul-Haq seized power in July 1977, the ISI was expanded by making it responsible for the collection of intelligence about the Sindh-based Pakistan Communist Party and various political parties such as the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP). The Soviet-Afghan war of the 1980s saw the enhancement of the covert action capabilities of the ISI by the US Central Intelligence Agency (CIA). A special Afghan Section was created under the command of colonel Mohammed Yousaf to oversee the coordination of the war. A number of officers from the ISI's Covert Action Division received training in the US and many covert action experts of the CIA were attached to the ISI to guide it in its operations against the Soviet troops by using the Afghan Mujahideen.

[TAB]The required education for a child of a noble family included writing, religious instruction, physical education, and training in the courtly arts. A noble child would begin attending school between the ages of five and seven years of age. The hammozgar, or teacher would instract him in writing and memorization of the Zoroastrian holy scriptures, as well as to recite the yasts and hold the Barsom, or sacred bundle, at a very early age. As well he would be versed in astrology, literature, writing and the law. He would also be trained in the etiquette of the court, ceremonies, how to treat women, gardening, and singing. He would play games such as chess and Backgammon. He would further be trained in horsemanship, hunting, archery, wrestling, polo, and the military arts, with his training and studies completed by the age of fifteen.

[TAB]The Nipa hut also known as Bahay Kubo, is an indigenous house used in the Philippine Islands. The native house is constructed out of bamboo tied together, with a thatched roof using dried grass.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nipa huts were once the native houses of the indigenous people of the Philippines before the Spaniards arrived, and is still used today, especially in rural areas. Different architectural designs are present among the different ethno-linguistic groups in the country, although all of them conform to being stilt houses, similar to those found in neighboring countries such as Indonesia, Malaysia, Palau, and the Pacific Islands.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[TAB]Tyrian purple, also known as royal purple or imperial purple, is a purple-red dye which was first produced by the ancient Phoenicians in the city of Tyre.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tyrian purple was expensive: the fourth-century BC historian Theopompus reported, "Purple for dyes fetched its weight in silver at Colophon" in Asia Minor.[PARAGRAPH:1]The dye substance occurs naturally, but must be harvested by humans. It consists of a fresh mucus secretion from the hypobranchial gland of a medium-sized predatory sea snail, commonly called the spiny dye-murex, a species in the family Muricidae, the murex or rock shells.[PARAGRAPH:1]In nature the snails use the secretion as part of their predatory behaviour, but the snail also secretes this substance when it is poked or physically attacked by humans. Therefore the dye can be collected either by "milking" the snails, which is more labor intensive but is a renewable resource, or by collecting and then crushing the snails completely, which is destructive.[PARAGRAPH:1]As well as Tyrian purple, the Phoenicians also made a purple-blue indigo dye, referred to as royal blue or hyacinth purple, which was made from a closely-related species of marine snail.[PARAGRAPH:1]The fast, non-fading dye was an item of luxury trade, prized by Romans, who used it to colour ceremonial robes. It is believed that the intensity of the purple hue improved, rather than faded, as the dyed cloth aged. Pliny the Elder described the dyeing process of two purples in his Natural History: ... the Tyrian hue ... is considered of the best quality when it has exactly the colour of clotted blood, and is of a blackish hue to the sight, but of a shining appearance when held up to the light; hence it is that we find Homer speaking of "purple blood".[PARAGRAPH:1]Archaeological data from Tyre indicate that the snails were collected in large vats and left to decompose. This produced a hideous stench that was actually mentioned by ancient authors. Not much is known about the subsequent steps, and the actual ancient method for mass-producing the two murex dyes has not yet been successfully reconstructed.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[TAB]A crannog is the name given in Scotland and Ireland to an artificial island or natural island, used for a settlement. The name can also be used to refer to wooden platforms erected on shallow loch floors, although understandably few remains of this sort have been found.[PARAGRAPH:1]The choice of an island as a home is thought to have been for defence as well as the availability of food in the form of fish nearby. The crannog could be reached from the nearest shore by means of a causeway built up with stones, or else a wooden gangway built atop raised piles.[PARAGRAPH:1]The islet of Eilean Domhnuill, Loch Olabhat on North Uist may be the earliest crannóg, dated to 3200-2800 BC in the Neolithic period. Most crannógs were in use from the Iron Age through to the early Medieval period, at about the same time as the brochs, the wags, duns and the larger roundhouses.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[TAB] Piliakalniai are hill forts in ancient and medieval Lithuania. The first piliakalniai are dated to the 1st millennium BC. Most forts were refortified in later centuries against the constant invasions of the Teutonic Knights. Most of the forts were located on the banks of a river, or where two rivers met. The hill was often sculpted for defense, with flattened tops and steeper slopes. The fortifications also were typically wooden, though some had stone or brick walls. During the early years of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, piliakalniai played a major role in battles against the Livonian Order and Teutonic Knights. During that time, their construction decreased but they became stronger. Their effectiveness decreased as firearms and cannons developed, and their numbers began to decline.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Piliakalniai sont collines fortifiées dans l'Antiquité et au Moyen Lituanie. La première piliakalniai sont à la date du 1er millénaire avant notre ère. Les plus forts sont refortified siècles plus tard, en constante contre les invasions des chevaliers teutoniques. La plupart des ouvrages sont situés sur les rives d'un fleuve, ou lorsque deux rivières remplies. La colline était souvent sculpté de la défense, avec des sommets aplatis et pentes plus raides. Les fortifications sont aussi généralement en bois, même si certains ont des murs de pierre ou de brique. Au cours des premières années du Grand-Duché de Lituanie, piliakalniai joué un rôle majeur dans les batailles contre l'Ordre livonien et les chevaliers teutoniques. Pendant ce temps, leur construction a augmenté, mais elles sont devenues plus fortes. Leur efficacité diminue à mesure que les armes à feu et de canons développés, et leur nombre a commencé à diminuer.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Piliakalniai Hügel sind Festungen in der Antike und Mittelalter Litauen. Die erste piliakalniai sind datiert auf das 1. Jahrtausend v. Chr.. Die meisten refortified Festungen wurden in späteren Jahrhunderten gegen die ständigen Invasionen der Deutschen Ritterorden. Die meisten Forts befanden sich am Ufer eines Flusses, wo zwei Flüsse oder erfüllt werden. Der Hügel wurde oft Skulpturen für Verteidigung, mit abgeflachtem Tops und steiler Hänge. Die Festung wurde in der Regel auch aus Holz, aber einige hatten Stein oder Ziegelwände. Während der frühen Jahre des Großfürstentums Litauen, piliakalniai spielte eine wichtige Rolle in der Schlacht gegen den Livländischen Ordens und Deutschen Ritterorden. Während dieser Zeit, deren Bau aber sie erhöht wurde stärker. Ihre Wirksamkeit zurückgegangen als Schusswaffen und Kanonen entwickelt, und ihre Zahl begann zu sinken.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Piliakalniai sono collina e antiche fortificazioni medievali e Lituania. Il primo piliakalniai sono datati al 1 ° millennio aC. La maggior parte delle fortezze erano refortified nei secoli successivi la costante contro le invasioni dei Cavalieri Teutonico. La maggior parte delle fortezze erano situato sulle rive di un fiume, o dove ha incontrato due fiumi. La collina è stata spesso scolpito per la difesa, con cime appiattite e pendenze. Anche le fortificazioni sono stati in genere di legno, anche se ha avuto alcuni muri in pietra o in mattoni. Durante i primi anni del Granducato di Lituania, piliakalniai svolto un ruolo importante nella battaglia contro la Livonian Ordine Teutonico e Cavalieri. Durante quel tempo, la loro costruzione è aumentato, ma è diventata più forte. La loro efficacia è diminuita, come armi da fuoco e cannoni sviluppato, e il loro numero ha iniziato a declinare.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Piliakalniai son fuertes en la colina de la antigua y medieval de Lituania. La primera fecha se piliakalniai a la 1 ª milenio antes de Cristo. Los más fuertes fueron refortified siglos más tarde en contra de las invasiones constantes Teutónica de los Caballeros. La mayoría de las fortalezas se encuentra en la orilla de un río, o en los que se reunió dos ríos. La colina era a menudo esculpida para la defensa, con cimas aplanadas y escarpadas laderas. Las fortificaciones fueron también típicamente de madera, aunque había algunos muros de piedra o ladrillo. Durante los primeros años de la Gran Ducado de Lituania, piliakalniai desempeñado un papel importante en las batallas contra el Livonian Orden Teutónica y Caballeros. Durante ese tiempo, el aumento de su construcción, sino que se convirtió en más fuerte. Su efectividad se redujo como las armas de fuego y cañones desarrollados, y su número empezó a disminuir.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Sweat Lodges have long been used by the earliest north Americans for healing and ritualistic purposes. From earliest recorded time, peyote has been used by indigenous peoples, such as the Huichol of northern Mexico and by various Native American Tribal Groups. There is documented evidence of the religious, ceremonial, and healing uses of peyote dating back over 20,000 years. The tradition began to spread northward as part of a revival of native spirituality under the auspices of what came to be known as the Native American Church, whose members refer to peyote as "the sacred medicine", and use it to combat alcoholism and spiritual, physical, and other social ills.

Kurash is a form of upright jacket wrestling native to Uzbekistan, practiced since ancient times. This Central Asian sport developed thousands of years ago as a form of training for fighting, for both self-defence and war. This is reflected in the rules, where clothing is required which mimics armour or battle-garb, and where grips on the trousers and ground fighting are banned, since bending over low or going to the ground make a fighter vulnerable to weapon thrusts. The emphasis on standing fighting develops strong balance and quick footwork, which help greatly when fighting with weapons.

[TAB]Ringforts are fortified settlements that are generally agreed to be from the Early Medieval period in Northern Europe, especially Ireland. A ráth was made of earth and caiseal or cathair were made of stone. A dun is a more prestigious site, the seat of a ruler. Historical or archaeological record of the Early Medieval Period in Ireland doesn't come close to the ringfort. Over 45,000 sites have been identified as ringforts throughout Ireland, but over 60,000 sites can be identified. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ringforts are traditionally understood as being a dispersed farmstead, the home of a free man and his family. This veiw has been altered, saying that not all ringforts are not farmsteads, but that they fill a variety of functions. Other ringfort sites have provided evidence that ringforts played a significant role in the economy of Ireland. Excavations have lead to the finding of pottery at ringfort sites suggesting that they may have been used as trading posts or other settlement functions. Yet another theory is that the ringforts were used for defense both because of its name and archaeological evidence. Ringforts may have been built to give protection to cattle-farming communities and guard their livestock. The circular shape of the ringfort also shows its defensive advantages. Explanations from the Early christian period support another idea: ringforts were built to signify nobility, kingship, and authority. The more elaborate the ringfort, the higher the status of the occupant. The promotion of one's status was the main purpose of construction of these ringforts.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Ringforts sont fortifiés qui sont généralement accepté d'être le début de la période médiévale dans le nord de l'Europe, en particulier en Irlande. Un ráth a été faite de terre et caiseal ou cathair sont en pierre. A plus dun est un site prestigieux, le siège d'un dirigeant. Historique ou archéologique analytique de la Petite Période Médiévale en Irlande est loin de la ringfort. Plus de 45000 sites ont été identifiés comme ringforts dans toute l'Irlande, mais plus de 60000 sites peuvent être identifiés. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ringforts sont traditionnellement comprise comme étant un ferme dispersés, le honme d'un homme libre et sa famille. Cette veiw a été modifié, en disant que ce n'est pas tout ringforts ne sont pas fermes, mais qu'ils remplissent une série de fonctions. Autres ringfort sites ont apporté la preuve que ringforts joué un rôle important dans l'économie de l'Irlande. Les fouilles ont conduit à la découverte de la poterie à ringfort des sites suggérant qu'ils auraient été utilisés comme postes de règlement ou d'autres fonctions. Une autre théorie est que l'ringforts ont été utilisés pour la défense tant en raison de son nom et de témoins archéologiques. Ringforts peut avoir été construite pour protéger le bétail, les communautés agricoles et protège son bétail. La forme circulaire de la ringfort montre aussi ses avantages défensifs. Explications de la petite période de l'ère chrétienne soutien une autre idée: ringforts ont été construits pour signifier la noblesse, la royauté, et de l'autorité. Les plus élaborés la ringfort est élevé, plus le statut de l'occupant. La promotion de l'un de ces droits était l'objectif principal de la construction de ces ringforts.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Ringforts sind befestigte Siedlungen, die im Allgemeinen vereinbart, werden aus dem frühen Mittelalter Zeitraum, in Nordeuropa, vor allem in Irland. Ein ráth wurde aus der Erde und caiseal oder cathair waren aus Stein. Ein mahnen ist eine angesehene, der Sitz eines Herrschers. Historischen oder archäologischen Eintrag der Frühen Mittelalter in Irland nicht in die Nähe der ringfort. Mehr als 45000 Websites wurden als ringforts in ganz Irland, aber über 60000 Seiten ermittelt werden können. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ringforts sind traditionell verstanden als eine verstreute Gehöft, die honme ein freier Mann und seiner Familie. Diese veiw verändert wurde, und sagte, dass nicht alle ringforts sind nicht Bauernhöfe, aber sie füllen eine Vielzahl von Funktionen. Andere ringfort Websites haben den Nachweis erbracht ringforts spielte eine wichtige Rolle in der Wirtschaft der Republik Irland. Ausgrabungen haben zu dem Ergebnis, der Töpferei auf ringfort Websites dass sie wurden als Handelspartner Stellen oder andere Siedlung. Doch eine andere Theorie ist, dass die ringforts wurden für die Verteidigung wegen seines Namens und archäologische Beweise. Ringforts Mai wurden gebaut, um den Schutz der Rinder - Landwirtschaft Gemeinden und bewachen ihr Vieh. Die runde Form des ringfort zeigt auch seine defensiven Vorteile. Erklärungen aus der frühen christlichen Zeit Unterstützung eine andere Idee: ringforts wurden gebaut, um zu verstehen, Adel, Königtum, und Autorität. Die weitere Ausarbeitung des ringfort, desto höher der Status der Insassen. Die Förderung von einem Status war das Hauptziel der Bau dieser ringforts.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Ringforts sono fortificati insediamenti, che sono generalmente accettato di essere anticipato dal periodo medievale nel Nord Europa, soprattutto in Irlanda. Un ráth è stato fatto della terra e del caiseal o cathair sono stati fatti di pietra. A dun tratta di un sito più prestigiosa, la sede di un righello. Storico o archeologico, di registrare i primi medievale Periodo in Irlanda non avvicinarsi alla ringfort. Oltre 45000 siti sono stati identificati come ringforts in tutta l'Irlanda, ma oltre 60000 siti possono essere identificati. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ringforts sono tradizionalmente inteso come un disperso maso, il honme di un uomo libero e la sua famiglia. Questo veiw è stato modificato, dicendo che non tutti ringforts non sono masi, ma che possono riempire una varietà di funzioni. Altri ringfort siti hanno fornito prove del fatto che ringforts svolto un ruolo significativo per l'economia irlandese. Gli scavi hanno portato alla constatazione di ceramica a ringfort siti suggerendo che essi potrebbero essere stati utilizzati come posti di scambio o di altre funzioni di regolamento. Ma un'altra teoria è che il ringforts sono stati utilizzati per la difesa, sia a causa del suo nome e archeologico prove. Ringforts potrebbe essere stata costruita per dare protezione alle comunità agricole - bovini e custodire il loro bestiame. La forma circolare del ringfort mostra anche i suoi vantaggi difensiva. Spiegazioni dal Primo periodo cristiano sostegno un'altra idea: ringforts sono stati costruiti a significare nobiltà, regalità, e di autorità. Il più elaborato il ringfort, maggiore è lo stato dei occupante. La promozione di uno status è stato l'obiettivo principale di costruzione di questi ringforts.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Ringforts son asentamientos fortificados que se acordó en general que se de la Early Medieval período en el norte de Europa, especialmente Irlanda. A ráth se hizo de la tierra y caiseal o cathair estaban hechos de piedra. A dun de más es un lugar de prestigio, la sede de un gobernante. Histórico o arqueológico acta de la Early Medieval Período en Irlanda no se acerca a la ringfort. Más de 45000 sitios han sido identificados como ringforts en toda Irlanda, pero más de 60000 sitios pueden ser identificados. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ringforts tradicionalmente entendida como la dispersión de una granja, la honme de un hombre libre y su familia. Este veiw ha sido alterado, diciendo que no todos los ringforts no son granjas, sino que cubrir una variedad de funciones. Otros ringfort sitios han proporcionado pruebas de que ringforts desempeñado un papel importante en la economía de Irlanda. Las excavaciones han llevado a la conclusión de la cerámica en ringfort sitios lo que hace pensar que pueden haber sido utilizados como puestos de comercio o de otras funciones de arreglo. Otra teoría es que la ringforts se utilizaron para la defensa tanto por su nombre y la evidencia arqueológica. Ringforts puede haber sido construido para dar protección a la cría de las comunidades agrícolas y la guardia de su ganado. La forma circular de la ringfort también muestra sus ventajas defensivas. Explicaciones de los primeros cristianos período de apoyo otra idea: ringforts fueron construidas para significar la nobleza, la monarquía, y de la autoridad. El más complicado en el ringfort, mayor es la situación de los ocupantes. La promoción de la condición es el objetivo principal de la construcción de estos ringforts.

TEXT.English: [TAB]If the Scythians were not the first to domesticate the horse they were among the earliest, if not the first of the Central Asian people to learn to ride it. Mounted soldiers was the Scythians' success in war; so when they penetrated into Asia, the technique of riding was rapidly adopted and mastered throughout the entire Middle Eastern area.[PARAGRAPH:1]Though the Scythian had elaborate bitted bridles, the stirrup was not known to them and they rode on saddleclothes, relying on grip and balance. Even so, they were formidable horsemen in battle.

[TAB]When Alexander the Great died he left behind a power vacuum only to be filled by his generals, the Diadochi, who carved up his empire for themselves. One of these generals, Seleucus I, was proclaimed chiliach, or General of the Army, under Perdiccas.[NEWLINE][TAB]When Perdiccas was murdered in 321bc, which Seleucus had a hand in; he moved quickly to seize Babylon and the entirety of the Old Persian Empire. At the time of Seleucus own murder he was in control of the largest of the Successor kingdoms, with an empire that stretched from Asia Minor to India.[NEWLINE][TAB]To help control the towns and cities local magistrates worked from a building called the Seleukeion. These buildings managed everything from day to day running of the city. To trade along the vital trade routes east. Principles among those were the Persian Royal Road and the Silk Road.

[TAB]A Nizamiyya is one of the medieval institutions of higher education established by Khwaja Nizam al-Mulk in the eleventh century in present-day Iran. The name nizamiyyah derives from his name. Founded at the beginning of the Seljuk empire, they are considered to be the model of madrassas, or Islamic religious schools. Nizamiyyah institutes were the first well organized universities in the Muslim world. The quality of education was the highest in the Islamic world, and they were even renowned in Europe. They were supported financially, politically, and spiritually by the royal establishment and the elite class. The most famous and celebrated of all the nizamiyyah schools was Al-Nizamiyya of Baghdad (established 1065), where Khwaja Nizam al-Mulk appointed the distinguished philosopher and theologian, al-Ghazali, as a professor. Persian poet Sa'di was a student of the Baghdad Nizamiyyah. Other nizamiyyah schools were located in Nishapur, Balkh, Herat and Isfahan.

[TAB]The sultanates and republics of Merca, Mogadishu, Barawa, Hobyo and their respective ports became profitable trade outlets for commodities originating from the interior of the State. The farming communities of the hinterland brought their products to the coastal cities, where they were sold to local merchants who maintained a lucrative foreign commerce with ships sailing to and coming from Arabia, India, Venetia, Persia, Egypt, Portugal, and as far away as China. Vasco Da Gama, who passed by Mogadishu in the 15th century, noted that it was a large city with houses of four or five storeys high and big palaces in its centre and many mosques with cylindrical minarets. In the 16th century, Duarte Barbosa noted that many ships from the Kingdom of Cambaya sailed to Mogadishu with cloths and spices for which they in return received gold, wax and ivory. Barbaso also highlighted the abundance of meat, wheat, barley, horses, and fruit on the coastal markets, which generated enormous wealth for the merchants. Mogadishu, the center of a thriving weaving industry known as toob benadir (specialized for the markets in Egypt and Syria), together with Merca and Barawa also served as transit stops for Swahili merchants from Mombasa and Malindi and for the gold trade from Kilwa. Jewish merchants from the Hormuz also brought their Indian textile and fruit to the Somali coast in exchange for grain and wood.

[TAB]The word braaivleis (pronounced "bry-flays") is Afrikaans for "roasted meat". The word braai (pronounced "bry", rhyming with the word "cry") is Afrikaans for "barbecue" or "roast" and is a social custom in South Africa and Zimbabwe. It originated with the Afrikaner people, but has since been adopted by South Africans of many ethnic backgrounds. The word vleis is Afrikaans for "meat", so in this word, the "s" is not a plural.

[PARAGRAPH:1][TAB]The Old Swiss Confederacy was an alliance among the valley communities of the central Alps. The Confederacy facilitated management of common interests (free trade) and ensured peace on the important mountain trade routes.

[TAB]A ting is a governing assembly in Scandinavian societies, made up of the free people of the area and supervised by judges. Medieval Scandinavia was dominated by warring clans and tribes, and a body of law was required to settle disputes. In Sweden, ting is not only used when referring medieval assemblies, but also for sub-national county councils, which are called Landsting. The name was also used in medieval times for tings that government the historical Landskap provinces. The name was also found in the names of the first level instances of the Swedish court system.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Ting est un ensemble régissant dans les sociétés scandinaves, composées des personnes libres du secteur et dirigées par des juges. La Scandinavie médiévale a été dominée par les clans et les tribus faisants la guerre, et un corps de loi a été exigé pour régler des conflits. En Suède, ting est non seulement employé en se référant les assemblées médiévales, mais également pour les County Councils sous-nationaux, qui s'appellent Landsting. Le nom a été également employé dans des périodes médiévales pour des tings ce gouvernement les provinces historiques de Landskap. Le nom a été également trouvé dans les noms des premiers exemples de niveau du système de cour suédois.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Ting ist eine regelnversammlung in den skandinavischen Gesellschaften, gebildet von den freien Leuten des Bereichs und von den Richtern überwacht. Mittelalterliches Skandinavien wurde durch warring Clane und Stämme beherrscht, und ein Körper des Gesetzes wurde angefordert, Debatten zu vereinbaren.
