In Schweden wird das Ting nicht nur verwendet, wenn man mittelalterliche Versammlungen, aber auch für sub-national Grafschaftsräte verweist, die Landsting angerufen werden. Der Name wurde auch in den mittelalterlichen Zeiten für tings diese Regierung die historischen Landskap Provinzen verwendet. Der Name wurde auch in den Namen der ersten Niveauinstanzen der schwedischen Gerichtsverfassung gefunden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ting è un complessivo governante nelle società scandinave, composte della gente libera della zona e sorvegliate dai giudici. La Scandinavia medioevale è stata dominata dai clan e dalle tribù facenti la guerra e un corpo di legge è stato richiesto depositare le dispute. In Svezia, ting non solo è usato quando fa riferimento i complessivi medioevali, ma anche per i County Council sub-nazionali, che sono denominati Landsting. Il nome inoltre è stato usato nei periodi medioevali per i tings quel governo le province storiche di Landskap. Il nome inoltre è stato trovato nei nomi dei primi casi del livello del sistema di corte svedese.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Ein Ting ist eine regelnversammlung in den skandinavischen Gesellschaften, gebildet von den freien Leuten des Bereichs und von den Richtern überwacht. Mittelalterliches Skandinavien wurde durch warring Clane und Stämme beherrscht, und ein Körper des Gesetzes wurde angefordert, Debatten zu vereinbaren. In Schweden wird das Ting nicht nur verwendet, wenn man mittelalterliche Versammlungen, aber auch für sub-national Grafschaftsräte verweist, die Landsting angerufen werden. Der Name wurde auch in den mittelalterlichen Zeiten für tings diese Regierung die historischen Landskap Provinzen verwendet. Der Name wurde auch in den Namen der ersten Niveauinstanzen der schwedischen Gerichtsverfassung gefunden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Club Tropicana is a world known cabaret and club in Havana, Cuba. It was launched in 1939 on a six-acre suburban estate in Havana. Heralded as a "Paradise Under the Stars," the Tropicana became known for its showgirls, conga sounds, domino tournaments and flashy, spectacular productions. When the indoor cabaret at the air-conditioned Arcos de Cristal opened on March 15, 1952, it had a combined total seating capacity of 1,700 for the interior and outside areas.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Tropicana had an impact in spreading Cuban culture internationally. The Tropicana was hardly a sleazy Mob hangout but rather a world-class entertainment venue that discriminating gangsters happened to enjoy frequenting. An excellent resource on Cuban popular culture, lavish entertainment, and everyday life.[NEWLINE]Party all night and free Salsa lessons with a two drink minimum!

[TAB]Central to every Greek city and town was the agora, a marketplace and meeting place. It was a large, usually rectangular space surrounded by buildings. Platforms, altars and statues of gods, sportsmen and political figures could also be found there. The stoa, which formed an edge of the agora, was a long building with columns. Shops were located in the stoa. More expensive items could be bought here.[PARAGRAPH:1]In some cities, local councils met in nearby buildings; other buildings were used to store public records and important political documents. Public spectators could watch criminals being placed on trial in the agora.[PARAGRAPH:1]Men and slaves usually did the shopping, with slaves and donkeys carrying the purchases; wealthier women may have visited to buy perfumes, jewellery and expensive cloth.[PARAGRAPH:1]Farmers came with their produce. In the large empty space of the agora, stallholders set up their sun shaded tables and sold such items as meat, fish, fruits and vegetables, cheeses, eggs, honey, wine, olive oil and animals (e.g. donkeys, horses, hens). Fresh meat and fish were displayed on marble slabs that kept the food cool. "Fast food" was also sold to hungry and thirsty shoppers. Slaves were placed on display and bought and sold.[PARAGRAPH:1]Merchants also bought and sold exotic foreign items in the agora. Ivory and gems came from Egypt, elephants from India, silk from China, wool from countries surrounding Greece, purple dye from the eastern countries, grain from areas around the Black Sea.[PARAGRAPH:1]Craftsmen had stalls, shops or workshops in or near the agora. Here they sold their goods or took orders. Sandles could be measured and made, barbers would trim hair and beards. Money changers and bankers would also conduct their business here.[PARAGRAPH:1]Men seeking employment would mix with employers looking for labourers. Some of those seeking work could be professionals or tradesmen, or they could have no skills.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the shady parts of the agora, family and friends could meet for a chat, while business people could make deals. Citizens could join in, or listen to, discussions about community and political issues. They may have watched musical and theatrical entertainments.[PARAGRAPH:1]Women and slaves could use a public fountain in the agora to collect their daily supply of water in pots.[PARAGRAPH:1]Busy and bustling, the agora was a vital area for a community.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[TAB]A maloca is an ancestral long house used by the natives of the Amazon, notably in Colombia and Brazil. Each community has a maloca with its own unique characteristics. For many years, these long houses were missionaries' objects of attack. Several families with patrilineal relations live together in a maloca, distributed around the long house in different compartments. In general, the chief of the local descent group lives in the compartment nearest to the back wall of the long house. As well, each family has its own furnace. During festivals and in formal ceremonies, which involve dances for males, the long house space is rearranged; the centre of the long house is the most important area where the dance takes place.

The Urhokpota building worked as a courthouse in the Empire of Benin. It is said that the charm which was buried at the gate of the Palace brought prosperity to the Kingdom. The Oba lodged Okpota in a house near the Palace in the area of the present day Exhibition Centre. The verandah to his house soon became a meeting place for the elders, even for the Oba, and Urhokpota has ever since remained a Centre for meeting and useful deliberations.

[TAB]The Uyghur people are hugely welcoming to guests. The grape arbor provides blissful shelter from the relentless sun, and to sit here in such a comfortable courtyard and enjoy a moment of cool breeze under the grapevine is a real treat in itself. Even if you were a stranger, they would welcome you with whole-hearted hospitality, offering all they have - from tea to fresh fruits to dry fruits to home made yogurt to refresh you.

[TAB]The Nubians had their own way of constructing vaults, called the Nubian Vault. It was used to construct various buildings, such as granaries. One of the key advantages of the Nubian vault is that it can be built without any support or shuttering. The bricks were laid leaning at a small slope against the gabble walls in a length-wise vault. The ancient Nubian technique was later revived by the Egyptian architect Hassan Fathy in the 1940's.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le Nubians a eu leur propre manière de construire des chambres fortes, appelée la chambre forte de Nubian. Il a été employé pour construire de divers bâtiments, tels que des greniers. Un des avantages principaux de la chambre forte de Nubian est qu'il peut être construit sans n'importe quel appui ou shuttering. Les briques étaient penchement étendu à une petite pente contre les murs gabble dans une chambre forte en long. La technique antique de Nubian plus tard a été rétablie par l'architecte égyptien Hassan Fathy dans les années 40.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Nubians hatte ihre eigene Weise des Konstruierens der Wölbungen, genannt die Nubian Wölbung. Es wurde verwendet, um verschiedene Gebäude, wie Getreidespeicher zu konstruieren. Einer der Schlüsselvorteile der Nubian Wölbung ist, daß er ohne irgendeine Unterstützung oder Verschalung errichtet werden kann. Die Ziegelsteine waren gelegtes Lehnen an einer kleinen Steigung gegen die gabble Wände in einer Längswölbung. Die alte Nubian Technik wurde später vom ägyptischen Architekten Hassan Fathy in den vierziger Jahren wieder belebt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Nubians ha avuto loro proprio senso di costruzione delle volte, denominato la volta di Nubian. È stato usato per costruire le varie costruzioni, quali i granai. Uno dei vantaggi chiave della volta di Nubian è che può essere costruito senza alcun supporto o shuttering. I mattoni erano inclinzione posta ad un pendio piccolo contro le pareti gabble in una volta longitudinale. La tecnica antica di Nubian più successivamente è stata fatta rivivere dall'architetto egiziano Hassan Fathy nei 1940's.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Nubians tenía su propia manera de construir cámaras acorazadas, llamada la cámara acorazada de Nubian. Fue utilizado para construir varios edificios, tales como graneros. Una de las ventajas dominantes de la cámara acorazada de Nubian es que puede ser construido sin ninguna ayuda o shuttering. Los ladrillos eran el inclinarse puesto en una cuesta pequeña contra las paredes gabble en una cámara acorazada longitudinal. La técnica antigua de Nubian fue restablecida más adelante por el arquitecto egipcio Hassan Fathy en los años 40.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The word "veche" refers to popular assemblies in medieval Slavic countries. In the Kievan Rus, a medieval Ukrainian kingdom is known to be the origin of many of the other veches throughout Slavic countries. The earliest mentions of veches in Russian chronicles refer to examples in Belgorod, a city on the Dnieper in 977, the Novgorod Republic in 1016, and in Kiev in 1068. The assemblies discussed matters of war and peace, adopted laws, and called for and expelled rulers.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le mot « veche » se rapporte aux assemblées populaires dans les pays slaves médiévaux. Dans le Kievan Rus, un royaume ukrainien médiéval est connu pour être l'origine de plusieurs des autres veches dans tous les pays slaves. Les mentions les plus tôt des veches en chroniques russes se rapportent à des exemples dans Belgorod, à une ville sur le Dnieper dans 977, à la République de Novgorod en 1016, et à Kiev en 1068. Les assemblées ont discuté des points de guerre et de paix, ont adopté des lois, et ont appelé pour et ont expulsé des règles.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Wort veche bezieht sich auf populäre Versammlungen in den mittelalterlichen Slavic Ländern. Im Kievan Rus, bekannt ein mittelalterliches ukrainisches Königreich, um der Ursprung von vielen der anderen veches in Slavic Ländern zu sein. Die frühesten Erwähnungen von veches in den russischen Chroniken beziehen sich Beispiele in Belgorod, eine Stadt auf dem Dnieper in 977, die auf Novgorod Republik 1016 und in Kiew 1068. Die Versammlungen berieten über Sachen des Krieges und des Friedens, nahmen Gesetze an und verlangten und trieben Lehren weg.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La parola veche si riferisce ai complessivi popolari nei paesi medioevali di Slavic. Nel Kievan Rus, un regno ucraino medioevale è conosciuto per essere l'origine di molti degli altri veches durante i paesi di Slavic. Le menzioni più iniziali dei veches in chronicles russi si riferiscono agli esempi in Belgorod, ad una città sul Dnieper in 977, alla Repubblica di Novgorod in 1016 ed a Kiev in 1068. I complessivi hanno discusso sugli argomenti della guerra e della pace, hanno adottato le leggi ed hanno richiesto ed hanno espulso i righelli.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La palabra veche refiere a las asambleas populares en los países medievales de Slavic. En el Kievan Rus, un reino ucraniano medieval se conoce para ser el origen de muchos de los otros veches a través de los países de Slavic. Las menciones más tempranas de veches en los chronicles rusos refieren a ejemplos en Belgorod, a una ciudad en el Dnieper en 977, a la república de Novgorod en 1016, y en Kiev en 1068. Las materias discutidas asambleas de la guerra y paz, leyes adoptados, y llamado para y reglas expelidas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Vedas are a large corpus of texts originating in Ancient India. They form the oldest layer of Sanskrit literature and the oldest sacred texts of Hinduism. According to Hindu tradition, the Vedas "not human compositions", being supposed to have been directly revealed, and thus are called sruti ("what is heard"). Vedic mantras are recited at Hindu prayers, religious functions and other auspicious occasions.

[TAB]In 1986, the Sixth Party Congress introduced significant economic reforms with market economy elements as part of a broad economic reform package called "doi moi" (Renovation). Private ownership was encouraged in industries, commerce and agriculture. In many ways, this followed the Chinese model and achieved similar results. Vietnam achieved significant growth over the next decade-and-a-half, making it the world's second-fastest growing economy of the time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Upon taking power, Vietnamese communists had created a command economy in the nation. Collectivization of farms, factories and economic capital was implemented, and millions of people put to work in government programs. For many decades, Vietnam's economy was plagued with inefficiency and corruption in state programs. This trend seems to be reversing as a free market begins to take hold within the country.

[TAB] Villu is a Mitanni fish-deity. Mitanni was an ancient Hurrian kingdom that flourished in the 14th century BC. Villu is known today by a few surviving clay statues of him as a cult object. Villu was a god of water with influence over droughts and thirst. He was used in a jurisdictional role. People convicted of crimes involving the sea, water or blood would be stoned with the aforesaid statues to death. Were a criminal to be punished in any other way, Villu would decrease the river flow, causing drought and famine. Following the conquest of Mitanni by the Hittites, his cult and the punishment declined.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Villu Mitaniens est un poisson-divinité. Mitaniens hourrite est un ancien royaume qui prospéra dans le 14ème siècle avant JC. Villu est connue aujourd'hui par une poignée de survivants des statues d'argile de lui comme d'un objet-culte. Villu était un dieu de l'eau ayant une influence sur la sécheresse et la soif. Il a été utilisé dans un rôle juridictionnel. Les personnes condamnées pour des crimes liés à la mer, l'eau ou le sang sera lapidé avec lesdites statues à la mort. Étaient un criminel pour être punis de toute autre manière, Villu diminuerait le débit fluvial, entraînant la sécheresse et la famine. Après la conquête de Mitaniens par les Hittites, son culte et la sanction refusée.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Villu ist ein Mitanni Fisch-Gottheit. Mitanni war eine antike Hurrian Reich blühte, dass im 14. Jahrhundert v. Chr.. Villu bekannt ist heute von wenigen überlebenden Ton Statuen von ihm als Kult-Objekt. Villu war ein Gott des Wassers mit Einfluss auf Dürren und Durst. Er war in einer Gerichtsbarkeit Rolle. Die Leute sind, Straftaten im Zusammenhang mit dem Meer, das Wasser oder Blut wäre gesteinigt mit den genannten Statuen zu Tode. Waren ein Strafverfahren bestraft werden in irgendeiner anderen Art und Weise, Villu sinken würden den Fluss fließen, was Dürre und Hungersnot. Nach der Eroberung durch die Mitanni Hethiter, seinem Kult-und die Strafe abgelehnt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Villu è un pesce Mitanni-divinità. Mitanni era un antico regno Hurrian che fiorirono nel 14 ° secolo aC. Villu oggi è conosciuto da pochi superstiti argilla statue di lui come un oggetto di culto. Villu era un dio delle acque con influenza sulla siccità e la sete. Egli è stato utilizzato in un ruolo giurisdizionale. Persone condannate per reati che comportano il mare, l'acqua o il sangue sarebbe lapidato con i suddetti statue a morte. Sono un criminale di essere punito in qualsiasi altro modo, Villu farebbe diminuire la portata del fiume, provocando siccità e carestia. In seguito alla conquista di Mitanni dagli Ittiti, il suo culto e la punizione rifiutato.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Villu Mitanni pescado es una deidad-. Mitanni hurritas fue un antiguo reino que floreció en el siglo 14 antes de Cristo. Villu es conocida hoy por algunos supervivientes de las estatuas de arcilla como un objeto de culto. Villu era un dios de las aguas, con influencia en la sequía y la sed. Fue usado en una función jurisdiccional. Las personas condenadas por delitos relacionados con el mar, el agua o la sangre sería apedreado con las mencionadas estatuas a la muerte. Fueron un penal que se castiga de cualquier otra manera, Villu disminuiría el caudal del río, causando la sequía y el hambre. Tras la conquista de Mitanni por los hititas, su culto y la pena se redujo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cricket has been an established team sport for hundreds of years and is thought to be the second most popular sport in the world. It is a bat-and-ball sport contested by two teams, usually of eleven players each. More than 100 countries are affiliated to the International Cricket Council, cricket's international governing body. The sport's modern form originated in England, and is most popular in the present and former members of the Commonwealth. In the countries of South Asia, including India, Pakistan, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka, cricket is the most popular sport. It is also a major sport in England, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, Zimbabwe and the English-speaking countries of the Caribbean, which are collectively known in cricketing parlance as the West Indies.

[TAB]The Noin-Ula kurgans are located by the Selenga River in the northern Mongolia hills north of Ulan Bator. It was excavated in 1924-1925 by Pyotr Kozlov. One of Noin-Ula kurgans is notable for its rich burial of a Xiongnu ruler, Uchjulü-Chanuy. Most of the objects from Noin-Ula are now in the Hermitage Museum, while some artifacts unearthed later by Mongolian archaeologists are on display in the Mongolian National Museum, Ulan Bator. One kurgan contained a lacquer cup inscribed with the name of its Chinese maker and dated September 5, 13 AD.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Noin Ula burials consist of more than 200 large kurgans. Inside the kurgans are timber burial chambers. Noin Ula had horse burials and one tomb had especially lavish furnishings. The coffin was apparently made in China, and the interned person had many of his possessions buried with him. His horse trappings were elaborately decorated and his leather-covered saddle was threaded with black and red wool clipped to resemble velvet. Magnificent textiles included a woven wool rug lined with thin leather with purple, brown, and white felt appliqué work, and textiles of Greco-Bactrian, Parthian and Anatolian origin.[PARAGRAPH:1]Some objects are similar to the artifacts from Pazyryk in the Altay Mountains. As with the finds at Pazyryk, the Noin Ula graves had been flooded and subsequently frozen, thus preserving the organic material to an unprecedented degree. The tombs, plundered in antiquity, formed wooden burial chambers in deep shafts covered by earthen kurgans. Among the burial inventory were artifacts of the Hunnish craftsmen including weaponry, home utensils, art objects, and multiple Chinese artifacts from bronze, nephrite, lacquered wood and textiles. Many artifacts show that Huns actively participated in trade along the Great Silk Road.[PARAGRAPH:1]Among the Noin Ula art works are many imported objects and fragments of fabrics recognized as Greek. The fabric, color, weaving methods and embroidery of the cloth were similar to the cloth produced in the Greek colonies on the Black Sea coast for the Scythians, and from there they were flowing to the Huns, bringing along a knowledge about western countries. The Huns' later migration was planned and weighed: pushed from the borders of China and "Western Territory", they had to move to the borders of another agricultural culture, because isolation doomed them to poverty and obliteration.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[TAB]Qat is a flowering plant native to tropical East Africa, grown for use as a stimulant for centuries in the Horn of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. Chewing khat predates the use of coffee and is used in a similar social context. Its fresh leaves and tops are chewed or, less frequently, dried and consumed as tea, in order to achieve a state of euphoria and stimulation. It is estimated that several million people are frequent users of qat.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Many of the users originate from countries between Sudan and Madagascar and in the southwestern part of the Arabian Peninsula, especially Yemen. In Yemen, a majority of people chew the plant daily for long periods of their life. The traditional form of qat chewing in Yemen involves only male users; qat chewing by females is less formal and less frequent. Despite it being outlawed in most Muslim countries, Yemeni clerics have adopted a lenient stance on its use.
